result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Columbia County Court Conviction DNA
Restitution Stipulation filed.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Justin J Krueger in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 1 year probation, 40 days jail starting April 18, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Full-time employment, seeking employment, school or in treatment.  $815.10 restitution. $453 costs. No jail credit.
Unsigned Restitution Stipulation for $815.10, being $531.00, $210.00 and a surcharge of $74.10.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-18-2016 02:45 pm
